data.title: Local history
data.text: A small local museum to learn about Roseville, railroads, and much more.  Most fun is talking to the docents on duty to learn about the various exhibits.  While Roseville railroad history is prominent, you really have to take your time browsing and ask questions of the docents.  Small museum, great hospitably.

data.title: Roseville/Junction City History
data.text: I'm a huge history buff and I love all of the artifacts that this museum has of the history of Roseville (Junction City was the original name) and of Placer County. Every summer, the county has a Historic Trail that allows visitors to go to several Placer County Museums for free. If you are a history lover, or want to know more about your city, make this your first stop!

data.title: History Is It's Own Reward to Learn About It
data.text:
This is a museum that is occupying the once-city library. It is partially Carnegie-endowed, thus the name reference. It is replete with old things, railroad models to depict the large presence of the Southern Pacific main maintenance yard with two swivel tracks to efficiently maintain the large number of locomotives and railroad cars that called Roseville their home. 

Besides the normal pictures of different eras, it also has an excellent photography and introductory references to some of the mining and agricultural pursuits of locals in the area. 

It's very informative and is part of The Heritage Trail program the region has to make it easierfor people to learn about many of the museums, land grants and commercial activity that has occurred in the area. I can never seem to get enough of that kind of information, and if you are  a history buff, you'll be drawn in just like I was.
